lines.text:
[after getting the Kettles evicted]
Good day.

[grabs Birdie]
Listen here Birdie, it may be a good day for you, but it ain't for Pa. All the poor man wanted was a new tobacco pouch and instead he won a house he didn't want and he got a bad sunburn.

[about Pa's underwear]
It's the latest thing, Billy Reed said they'd fit perfectly.
They probably would if he were in them with me!

[laughs]
Well, we'll just pin them up for right now, they'll shrink once I wash them.

[all the kids announce themselves]
Nancy... no, I'm Susie.

[she and Pa are watching themselves on the news, and they're showing more children than just their 15]
Turn that thing off before our family gets any bigger!
Theories are nice, Ma, but not when they break up families and threaten lives.
